required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Added Value of Preoperative Contrast Enhanced Mammography in Staging of Malignant Breast Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Added Value of Preoperative Contrast Enhanced Mammography (PROCEM) in Staging of Malignant Breast Lesions - a Prospective Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Patients diagnosed with breast cancer after routine assessment with digital mammography and ultrasound and scheduled for primary surgery are included in the trial. The patients are randomized 1:1 to go through additional contrast enhanced mammography (CEM) or no further imaging preoperatively. Primary endpoint is rate of patients with change of treatment: a) mastectomy instead of partial mastectomy due larger unifocal or multifocal extent, b) partial mastectomy instead of mastectomy due to improved demarcation of the tumour area, c) bilateral surgery instead of unilateral due to findings of contralateral cancer, d) neoadjuvant therapy instead of primary surgery due to more advanced disease. Rate of reoperation and rate of avoidable mastectomies are secondary endpoints.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of patients with change of primary treatment due to findings at additional CEM
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within two months after diagnosis of breast cancer
primary_outcome.description: Mastectomy instead of partial mastectomy due to findings of multifocal disease, mastectomy instead of partial mastectomy due to larger unifocal extent, partial mastectomy instead of mastectomy due to improved demarcation of tumour area, bilateral surgery due to findings of contralateral cancer, primary neoadjuvant treatment instead of primary surgery due to more advanced disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within three months after diagnosis of breast cancer
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reoperations due to inadequate margins

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within three months after diagnosis of breast cancer
secondary_outcome.description: Patients operated with mastectomy where histopathology shows extent less than 3 cm

arm_group.description: Patients in experimental arm will go through additional preoperative staging with contrast enhanced mammography
Patients in No intervention arm will go through no additional preoperative imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned primary surgery for suspicious or verified breast malignancy Age of 18 years and above Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Planned neoadjuvant therapy On-going pregnancy Iodinated contrast agent allergy Renal failure (abnormal S-creatinine) Untreated thyreotoxicosis Inability to understand and comprehend oral and written information of the study

eligibility.gender_description: Breast cancer is very uncommon among men.
